Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a generally healthy plant that has enough water and sunlight.
The student can illustrate a plant that appears unhealthy due to a lack of water, using some indicators like drooping or discolored leaves.
The student can demonstrate through their drawings that plants need water to live and grow, although this might be shown in a straightforward manner without detailed embellishments.
The student can illustrate the difference between a watered plant and a plant without water by showing clear distinctions, such as vibrant vs. wilted leaves.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally omit some finer details, like the effect of sunlight, focusing more on water as the primary factor.
The student might show incomplete labeling or fail to label certain parts of the drawings, such as not identifying which plant is without water (inconsistent application of labeling).
The student may not fully demonstrate patterns over time, focusing on snapshot differences rather than changes over time (plant progression over time not shown).
